channel.title: Favorite iOS wav editor?
channel.description: I'm starting to explore importing my own samples in Auxy. But some samples need editing before importing. Do you have a favorite wav editor for iOS? Especially one that's easy for working with Auxy?

item.title: Favorite iOS wav editor?
item.dc:creator: Db909
item.description:
Ya Caustic is pretty awesome for creating samples. You can draw waveforms, apply fx endlessly, etc

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite iOS wav editor?
item.dc:creator: Lex
item.description:
I use this app called Lexis Audio Editor. It’s not fancy schmancy but it gets the job done for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite iOS wav editor?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
They’re the pre-cursor to audio unit effects/instruments… I can’t remember how many years ago they came out, but basically it was Apple’s answer to AudioBus, in a way. You can apply inter app audio (IAA) effects in a recording chain but cannot apply the effects after the fact (ie, apply IAA effects to recorded audio). In my experience at least… though I think Cubasis does some trickery that might make this possible (via resampling, I’d imagine).

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite iOS wav editor?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Ah well, I mean, NS2 is in the works, nearly done. NS1 is 32bit so if you’re not running an older device YOU CANNOT run NS1. NS2 is probably going to be pretty awesome…

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite iOS wav editor?
item.dc:creator: corey
item.description:
iammane:

Nanostudio, RIP

Is it official then? I’ve seen people asking about updates, but no announcement that it’s actually dead.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite iOS wav editor?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
It’s not free, and it does quite a bit more than just edit audio, but I recall Caustic having a pretty fleshed out wave editor too. So did Nanostudio, RIP.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite iOS wav editor?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Yessss plus you can get loops and etc from here directly. A little pricey imo, but these could be opened directly in Auxy as said

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite iOS wav editor?
item.dc:creator: Arimyth
item.description:
Yesss. Kymatica takes the cake for this one!

Audioshare is feature rich enough while still being fairly easy to use–definitely a solid choice. (Also as a side note, for anyone looking for a nice mobile audio mixer, I highly recommend AUM. )

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite iOS wav editor?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
My vote is for AudioShare as well, but anybody looking for a free solution could do worse than Audiocopy from Retronyms.

It can ‘open in’ Auxy as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite iOS wav editor?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
AudioShare, hands down. It’s by the same developer of Aum.

Depending on what kind of editing you want to do, like trimming, normalizing etc it’s probably all you’d need. You can also re-sample using IAA effects which is pretty cool. It’s also a decent enough recorder.

You can “open in” Auxy directly from AudioShare.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite iOS wav editor?

item.description:
I’m starting to explore importing my own samples in Auxy. But some samples need editing before importing. Do you have a favorite wav editor for iOS? Especially one that’s easy for working with Auxy?
